frame.name: Being_at_risk
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Asset</fen> is in a state where it is exposed to or otherwise liable to be affected by a <fen>Harmful_event</fen>, which may be metonymically evoked by reference to a <fen>Dangerous_entity</fen>. Words expressing relative safety (i.e., lack of risk) are also in this frame.
<ex>If you are a farmer, <fex name="Asset">you</fex> <m>are</m> <m>at</m> <t>risk</t> <fex name="Harmful_event">for hearing loss caused by noise exposure in your work</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Asset">No child</fex> <m>is</m> <t>secure</t> <fex name="Harmful_event">from the temptation to do what "my friends" are doing</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Our nation is making a disastrous mistake thinking that <fex name="Asset">we</fex> can <m>have</m> <t>security</t> <fex name="Dangerous_entity">from people</fex>: There is only security with people. </ex>
<ex><fex name="Asset">You</fex> don't <m>have</m> <t>security</t> <fex name="Harmful_event">against impersonation</fex> unless you have security against eavesdropping.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Asset
FE.definition:
<def-root>Something judged to be desirable or valuable which might be lost or damaged.
<ex>There is a locked padlock that guarantees <fex name="Asset">the information</fex> is <t>secure</t>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>A modifier expressing the deviation of the actual level of security from the expected value given the <fen>Asset</fen> and the state indicated by the target itself.
<ex>My mail is <fex name="deg">totally</fex> <t>secure</t> in this box.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Harmful_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action that may occur or a state which may hold which could result in the loss of or damage to the <fen>Asset</fen>.
<ex>Our system ensures that information stored within hardware is <t>secure</t> <fex name="har">from external software attack and physical theft</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Dangerous_entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>A concrete or abstract entity which may come to cause the loss of, or damage to the <fen>Asset</fen> either due to its participation in a <fen>Harmful_event</fen>.
<ex>We make sure your BMW is <t>secure</t> <fex name="dan">against intruders</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>A particular location in which the <fen>Asset</fen> is secure. Frequently, it is to be inferred that the characteristics of the location protect the <fen>Asset</fen> from a potential <fen>Harmful_event</fen>.
<ex>Workers need to make sure their property is <t>secure</t> <fex name="pla">at work</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Asset</fen> enjoys the specified level of security from a <fen>Harmful_event</fen>.
<ex> Israel is <t>insecure</t> <fex name="Time">today</fex> not because it does not have enough military power.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the state of security or insecurity of the <fen>Asset</fen> logically follows.</def-root>

FE.name: Situation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Situation</fen> under which the <fen>Asset</fen> is safe or unsafe.
<ex>Our children are <t>safe</t> <fex name="sit">with that criminal behind bars</fex>.</ex>
Most expressions of <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen> also express the <fen>Situation</fen> and should be labeled as such on the 2nd FE layer.</def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> in which the <fen>Asset</fen> has a degree of safety.
<ex>Students with Asthma need to <m>be</m> <fex name="dom">medically</fex> <t>safe</t> at school.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. </def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: secure.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: certain to remain safe and unthreatened.

lexUnit.name: security.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state of being or feeling secure.

lexUnit.name: safe.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: protected from or not exposed to danger or risk; not likely to be harmed or lost.

lexUnit.name: unsafe.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not safe or secure; in danger.

lexUnit.name: safety.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the condition of being safe.

lexUnit.name: risk.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the possibility that something unpleasant will happen.

lexUnit.name: vulnerable.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: exposed to being attacked or harmed, either physically or emotionally.

lexUnit.name: vulnerability.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being exposed to or likely to suffer harm.

lexUnit.name: danger.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the possibility of suffering harm or injury.
